channel.title: Portfolios on Marie Yatsyk
channel.description: Recent content in Portfolios on Marie Yatsyk

item.title: f(x) foods
item.description: In Fall 2018, I worked as a Studio Developer for Scout. In three months, our five-person student team (three designers, two developers) created a new brand identity and assets, packaging, a brand book, and a fully-functional marketing and e-commerce website for our client – a young granola bar company started by a Northeastern alumna. For the first half of the semester I focused on user experience design, helping create lo-fi packaging and website wireframes in addition to conducting user research and iterating on logo designs.

item.title: Philippines Country Data
item.description: This poster was created for the Information Design course at Northeastern University. We were asked to present 30 kinds of information about a country.

item.title: How to Make Jam
item.description: This poster was created for the information design class at Northeastern University. We were asked to show a process with at least 10 steps, using as few words as possible. I used watercolors to illustrate each step of the process. Colophon: Playfair Display

item.title: 3 Trips Visualization
item.description: This piece presents information about three trips: from my apartment to a classroom, from my apartment to my parents' home in New York, and from New York to Moscow. This piece was created for the information design class at Northeastern University, and is designed to be viewed as an accordion with 7 panels.

item.title: TripKick Travel Sidekick App Design
item.description: TripKick is a travel sidekick app that helps streamline the trip-planning process from research to on-the-go. Users start by collecting information about hotels, flights trip destinations in a browser extension / web application. From there, they can create a trip itinerary, and install the TripKick mobile app. In the time leading up to the trip, TripKick notifies users of dropped prices and discounts for their travel plans. During the trip, the app helps users navigate to their destinations, review attractions on TripAdvisor, and find alternate activities in case events get rained out or change hours unexpectedly.

item.title: Climate Change Poster
item.description: This dramatic poster uses data from climate.nasa.gov to showcase evidence of climate change, with a focus on melting polar ice caps. When I learned about global warming as a kid, I remember feeling a powerful urgency to try and change things. I tried to create an attention-grabbing poster that would both inform viewers and get them equally concerned about this issue.

item.title: Book Cover Series
item.description: For a Typography II assignment, I designed these book covers for a hypothetical series for the Canadian Center of Architecture about three influential architects: Louis Sullivan, Richard Neutra, and Frank Gehry. I wanted to showcase the unique aspects of each architect's works, and for this I drew inspiration from the architects' drafting sketches, which give an fascinating glimpse into their thought process.

item.title: Spooky FM Video Game
item.description: Title screen art by R. Giraud During the 2017 Global Game Jam, I worked on a team with six other students to build a video game from scratch in 48 hours. We created Spooky FM, a 2D side-scrolling survival game where you play as a radio DJ who tries to appease an influx of monsters by playing their favorite music. Battle your station’s awful WiFI connection and your own caffeine dependency while making sure to fulfill audience requests to keep the ratings up!

item.title: B2B Marketing Headline Generator
item.description: Just for fun, I created this generator that combines randomly-chosen buzzwords and business terms to create surprisingly plausible B2B content marketing headlines. View on GitHub

item.title: MindSet Web App Design
item.description: MindSet is a mood and habit tracking web app that aims to help users manage their stress by allowing them to track their weekly schedule (calendar data), to-do lists, and habits as well as other factors that affect their mood (such as exercise, amount of sleep, caffeine intake, etc.). Based on that data, the app makes suggestions for what the user should do each week to help improve their mood (ex: take a 20 minute nap on certain days, limit caffeine to no more than 2 cups a day, sit in the sun)

item.title: Typeface Posters
item.description: A promotional poster for the Gotham typeface, intended to be as clean, bold, and eye-catching as the type. This poster showcases letter-forms around Boston and Cambridge using a collage of photos I took myself.

item.title: Weather App
item.description: This simple web app connects to the OpenWeatherMap and Flickr APIs to show weather in a city and a lovely random image of said city. View on GitHub This was my first-ever web app, and was originally built at the HubSpot Women's WebApp Workshop, Fall 2016.

item.title: Northeastern University T-Shirt Design
item.description: Created for a contest organized by the Saint Stephen Street and Huntington (S.S. Huntington) dorms at Northeastern University. Process

item.title: Creative Coding Experiments
item.description: Just a silly self-portrait created using canvas shapes. Try clicking my face! A zen, randomly-generated pattern inspired by a mermaid's scales.

item.title: Anxious Tale
item.description: This interactive narrative was created in response to the prompt "elicit an emotion." I chose to explore the sensation of social anxiety. I also wanted to challenge myself to see if I could create a sense of unease and discomfort through very simple ASCII art-like illustrations. Experience the story

item.title: Sound Visualizer
item.description: This was one of my first ever coding projects, created for the Programming Basics course at Northeastern University. I wanted to create an interactive sound visualizer that responds to audio and user input. View on GitHub The mouse-following particle effects use a modified version of the particle effects are easy script by Hunter Loftis, and the particle size is tied to the volume of the sound captured from the browser microphone (using the p5.

item.title: Vector Art Experiments
item.description: A portrait of one of my favorite musicians: Dessa. -- -- -- -- -- -- Each flower was meticulously drawn using tiny straight lines, as a challenge in using the Adobe Illustrator pen tool without drawing curves.

item.title: Northeastern University Marketing Association
item.description: Promotional Flyers From January-December 2016, I wrote and designed the flyers for the club's weekly meetings, as well as the corresponding social media graphics (Facebook event header images, square graphics for Instagram posts, and banners for NUMA's website home page). Logo Design I designed the logo for the Northeastern University Marketing Association to help with their re-branding on campus.

item.title: There the form stood, motionless as the hill beneath.
item.description: This print was inspired by a passage in Thomas Hardy’s Return of the Native. It describes the lone figure of Eustacia Vye standing silhouetted on a barrow, while in the distance the other villages light bonfires, one by one, all across the heath. This project was my first foray into linoleum printmaking, and it enabled me to play around with different color combinations as a way of conveying different atmospheres.
